meanings.definition: Represent as or by an instance.
meanings.sent1: I can instantiate my idea by showing a real example.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will instantiate the concept with a hands-on activity.
meanings.sent3: Let's instantiate the plan by acting it out like a play.
meanings.sent4: She was able to instantiate her dream into a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent5: To truly understand, you must instantiate the theory in a practical way.

meanings.definition: Create an instance of a class.
meanings.sent1: I will instantiate a new object in the program.
meanings.sent2: The programmer needs to instantiate the class before using it.
meanings.sent3: It's like magic - you can instantiate a class into existence!
meanings.sent4: She was able to instantiate a strong bond with her students.
meanings.sent5: The artist will instantiate a masterpiece from their imagination.

meanings.definition: Give concrete or tangible form to an abstract concept.
meanings.sent1: Let's try to instantiate the idea into a physical model.
meanings.sent2: The sculpture will instantiate the theme of unity.
meanings.sent3: It's like trying to instantiate a dream into reality.
meanings.sent4: Her words were able to instantiate hope in the hearts of many.
meanings.sent5: The architect will instantiate the vision of the building through blueprints.
